sentence.Network_en: Those in his employ were careful never to enrage him.
sentence.Network_cn: 在他手底下干活的人都非常小心绝不去触怒他。

sentence.Network_en: As for the subjects that so enrage puritans, they will continue to form the focus of her work.
sentence.Network_cn: 那些使道学先生们勃然大怒的课题将继续成为她工作的重点。

sentence.Network_en: What I fancy I said to Melbury must have been enough to enrage any man.
sentence.Network_cn: 我相信我当时对麦尔布礼说的那些话足以激怒任何人.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent. (formerly also as inrage): from French enrager, from en- 'into' + rage 'rage, anger'

entry.def: If you are enraged by something, it makes you extremely angry.

example.ex: He was enraged by news of plans to demolish the pub...
example.tran: 看到计划拆除酒馆的新闻，他非常愤怒。

example.ex: He enraged the government by renouncing the agreement.
example.tran: 他否认那项协议，从而激怒了政府。

means.word_mean: 1. put into a rage; make violently angry

auth_sentence.content: My appearance, and her sense of relief, would enrage her.
auth_sentence.res_content: My appearance, and her sense of relief, would enrage her.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: My appearance, and her sense of relief, would enrage her.

auth_sentence.content: But with great hype comes great scrutiny, and Goblin is an album ready to enrage even the most liberal of listeners.
auth_sentence.res_content: But with great hype comes great scrutiny, and Goblin is an album ready to enrage even the most liberal of listeners.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But with great hype comes great scrutiny, and Goblin is an album ready to enrage even the most liberal of listeners.

auth_sentence.content: He says these are unfounded accusations concerning the opposite camp and are things that would enrage their supporters.
auth_sentence.res_content: He says these are unfounded accusations concerning the opposite camp and are things that would enrage their supporters.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He says these are unfounded accusations concerning the opposite camp and are things that would enrage their supporters.

stems_affixes.word_buile: outrage[n.粗暴,暴行]+ous……的→adj.粗暴的,无礼的
out外面+rage怒气→怒气外露→粗暴

sentences.en: I was enraged to find they had disobeyed my orders.
sentences.cn: 发现他们违抗了我的命令, 我极为恼火。
